intro: Trichocarya racemosa, commonly known as the clustered leaf saxifrage, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, succulent leaves that are covered in fine, hair-like structures called trichomes. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in a raceme, which bloom in early spring. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Trichocarya racemosa is adapted to survive in dry environments, with features such as thick leaves and a shallow root system to conserve water.
